results.title: Australian women's heritage: 1788-1901
results.brief_description: This visual history of Australian women documents the contribution of a previously overlooked group. Their work, their mothering and their civilising influence has been a major factor in Australia’s coming of age. This program begins with the daily life of Aboriginal women and also discusses issues important to these women later in the 19th Century. Also examines convict and free women; women’s contributions and life during the gold rush; fashion, education and family size, the impact of the 1890’s depression on women. Some individual women highlighted on this video are Mary Reiby, Caroline Chisholm, Louisa Lawson, Catherine Spence, Dame Nellie Melba, Mother Mary Mackillop, Truganini and Daisy Bates.

results.title: Australian wine uncorked! A History of wine on film
results.brief_description: Introduced by Len Evans, former director of the wine bureau, this ScreenSound documentary utilises archival footage and film reels to illustrate the history of the wine industry in Australia. Reaching Australia’s shores with the first settlers, a solitary vine and a pool of European viticulture expertise, the wine industry in Australia has created a plethora of famous vineyards and growers such as Penfolds, Brown Brothers, Great Western, Wolf Blass, Haughtons and the Hunter and Barossa Valley regions. The film includes advertising campaigns, product innovations, feast and famine in the industry, transportation, packaging and scientific research. Features footage from the following films: “Wines of Australia”, “From grape to glass”. Narrated by Hugh McKenzie.

results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.

results.title: Australian war memorial
results.creator_credit: John Gray, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An overview of the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, the quiet cloisters within it and the pictures, exhibits, dioramas, paintings, models and objects of war which recall the battles fought by Australians. Features the paintings and models which depict the 1915 Anzac landings in Turkey.

results.brief_description: Australian Walkabout is a TV series made for the ABC and BBC by director Charles Chauvel. It was the last project completed by Chauvel prior to his death.

results.title: Australian Vietnam Forces National Memorial dedication
results.creator_credit: Max Donnellan, Kinsie McDonald and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This video records the dedication ceremony of the Australian Vietnam forces war memorial, Canberra, in October 1992. The video also contains footage of Australian soldiers in action in the Vietnam conflict, speeches by the Prime Ministers Bob Hawke and Paul Keating, and a tree planting ceremony and speech about the Australian Vietnam Forces Memorial forest comprising a tree for every Australian soldier or civilian who lost their lives during the Vietnam conflict. Commentators include Bruce Webster, Bill Fogarty, Paul Berger and Graham Neil.
